info.title: MyVariant.info API
info.description: Documentation of the MyVariant.info Variant Query web services. Learn more about [MyVariant.info](http://myvariant.info/)

tags.name: query
tags.description: Make variant query and return matching variant list.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: Metadata about the data available from MyVariant.info.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: query string. Examples: "rs58991260", "chr1:69000-70000", "dbsnp.vartype:snp". The detailed query syntax can be found at http://docs.myvariant.info/en/latest/doc/variant_query_service.html#query-syntax

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any variant object (e.g. http://myvariant.info/v1/variant/chr16:g.28883241A>G). Note that it supports dot notation, and wildcards as well, e.g., you can pass "dbnsfp", "dbnsfp.genename", or "dbnsfp.aa.*". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the maximum number of matching gene hits to return (with a cap of 1000 at the moment). Default 10.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: the number of matching gene hits to skip, starting from 0. Combining with "size" parameter, this can be useful for paging. Default: 0.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: the comma-separated fields to sort on. Prefix with "-" for descending order, otherwise in ascending order. Default: sort by matching scores in decending order.

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: a single field or comma-separated fields to return facets, for example, “facets=dbsnp.vartype.

parameters.name: fetch_all
parameters.description: if TRUE, allows fast retrieval of all unsorted query hits in 1000 hit batches. The return object contains a _scroll_id field, which when passed back to the query endpoint in the scroll_id parameter, returns the next 1000 unordered results.

parameters.name: scroll_id
parameters.description: athe scroll_id from a previous request with fetch_all = TRUE. When this request is made, the response contains the next 1000 unordered query hits from your query (until no hits are left to return). As the query was supplied in the original query request (with fetch_all = TRUE), the query (q parameter) is ignored if scroll_id is supplied.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.
